intro: [WRONG START] Embilia intricata, commonly known as the Indian gooseberry or amla, is a deciduous shrub native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of white flowers. The plant produces small, yellowish-green berries that mature to a bright orange-red color. These berries are rich in vitamin C and have been used in traditional medicine for their antioxidant properties. The plant's botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and medicinal contexts.
